alert.note: Alert for Sutton (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued October 26 at 1:00AM CDT until October 26 at 5:00AM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM CDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of west central Texas, including the following counties, Kimble, Mason, Menard and Sutton. * WHEN...Until 400 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1259 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Junction, Mason, South Llano River State Park, Segovia, Yates Crossing, London, Telegraph, Saline, Roosevelt, Long Mountain, Streeter, Cleo, Us-83 Near The Kimble-Menard County Line, Us-83 Near The Kerr-Kimble County Line, Us-377 Near The Kimble-Edwards County Line, Us-377 Near The Kimble-Menard County Line, Erna, I-10 Near The Sutton-kKmble County Line and Koockville. - This includes Interstate 10 between Mile Markers 427 and 472. This includes the following Low Water Crossings... Park Road 73 crossing South Llano River, US HWY 377 crossing South Llano River, FM 2169 crossing Johnson Fork Creek, US HWY 377 crossing 2 miles North of Telegraph, RM 2291 crossings along Bear Creek, crossings along FM 1221, FM 2169 crossing Johnson Fork Creek, FM 2169 crossing Johnson Fork Creek, CR 150 crossing South Llano River and Old Junction crossing Honey Creek. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
